pageContext.claim: “I'll tell you, you know I was [in Cincinnati] -- I worked here for a long time.  People don't know; most people don't know.  Swifton Village, long time ago.… Came here a long time ago. I had a great success with my father. I was a young success. ”
pageContext.analysis: Trump did spend time in Cincinnati at Swifton Village. By all accounts, at best, he did menial labor around the property and we found no evidence that he ever lived there. There were charges of discrimination and a lawsuit during the Trumps ownership tenor. Without knowing the cost of repairs or legal expenses and the rental income, it's impossible to know if they profited on the project, but all signs suggest any profit they made was not a windfall or a "great success" by Trumpian standards.
